author: zoeselina
title: Science Hyperspace on Cardano
description: 科学总是在组织、参考、访问和获取方面存在问题。没有安全的空间来储存人类的知识。

f6_assessments.q0: In this challenge multiple fields are admitted. This is a very useful idea and a space to find lots of information stored in a secure way and easy to find. Innovative proposal and addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no proposal plan explained where the implementation is detailed and providing a bit of technical information. There is no team information where we can see if they are capable to implement the proposal or not.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs? Information about success? Only a little roadmap is explained but this will note be easily audited with this information and nothing is provided to measure the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you very much for your feedback. Yes, the proposal's idea is "still stuck in children's shoes" when I may literally translate a saying from German into English. I will work on the things you mentioned that need improvement, so thank you very much for sharing your thoughts!

f6_assessments.q0: There is a need for decentralized verification of credentials in the scientific world. However, there are some unjustifiable statements in the proposal like "Sciences are quite a mess, especially when it comes to Humanities. References, Dictionaries, cross-references, hypertexts etc".  This led one to believe that the proposer needs to reconsider and come up with a more justifiable proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The pososer claims to be a student ("I study languages/linguistics (germ & engl) and maths.") therefore i will be better to take support of his Institute to do research in the area of this his proposal with the help of this teachers.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan for first three months is " expect to have talked to as many people as possible and maybe even onboarded one or another" this is quite vague and breaking away from university to do it is not a very prudent idea to encourage.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback, I appreciate your inputs. I will see what I can do about the research with help from my institute! This is a good idea, so thank you.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very ambitious and proposes a verifiable scientific "metaverse" of sorts where scientific knowledge can live on the blockchain. I believe this proposal does effectively use Cardano in a way that grows the value of the network itself by serving as an important repository of scientific knowledge.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately this proposal is extremely vauge and lacks a clear roadmap and detailed plan for how to create this scientific hyperspace so I have my doubts about whether this proposal in it's current state would be successful. I would advise the proposer to consult with some technical minds in the blockchain space about how "A place where references are strings to another paper, a place where new editions are directly linked to older ones; a place where credibility and trust are verifiable," would work from a technical perspective, and then create a brief technical document about the mechanics of it and that would go a long way!
f6_assessments.q2:
I would like to see a roadmap with detailed milestones and specific KPIs for each milestone. The roadmap should be laid out in easy to digest bullet points with the milestones laid out clearly with specific detail.

Currently the proposal is much, much too vague to audit it comprehensively.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you so much for understanding my idea! Also thank you very much for your thoughts and inputs on how to improve the possible implementation. I will focus on these and am very grateful for your comments!

f6_assessments.q0: Connecting decentralized science data into one hyperspace platform is a great idea. But I have yet to see a specific solution or product offered by the proposer. Therefore, it is difficult to know the impact and practical application of the product. Proposal needs more than a simple idea like this.
f6_assessments.q1: This is such a huge project, it might seem a bit overwhelming for a college student. Although the proposer is a very passionate student of science and really wants to turn this idea into reality, I think that the proposer to implement this proposal alone is not enough. He/she needs to find more people with expertise in these areas. Because there is no specific product or solution, of course the proposal does not have a roadmap or plan
f6_assessments.q2:
"Proposal has not offered a specific solution, all are still ideas. Therefore, the proposal does not have a specific product and plan
No roadmap
No metrics
No timeline and budget breakdown
Nothing to audit"
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your assessment. Yes, it is still an idea. I need some point to start, though. I am not really expecting funds with this proposal yet, but of course it would kickstart my work since I have no capital at all.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea you gave is quite good, but its challange is not high. In order to create a large information storage place, there must be large resources. Information storage places must also have high security and convenience for users. In addition, when creating archives, the development team will need a high level of security with important knowledge documents. So personally, using a decentralized hyperspace is really difficult to manage and organize.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, you are currently still in the learning process, so we have not been able to determine your profile and experience. About the short-term roadmap in the first 3 months. In addition to building community, I think you should apply to big companies to practice learning and gain more knowledge. That will somewhat help your project in the future.
f6_assessments.q2: With the amount of $ 12000, I have not seen what you will use it for and how to use it. If it's with community building, this is a huge amount of money. I think you should have specific KPIs for using this money.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback and insights! I will work on these and take them into account, so I am very grateful. I am not seriously expecting getting funded this round; and yes, I did not explain for what I would use the budget. In the meantime, I figured out how I should have been proposing about that. Very much wrapped up: The most important thing would be hardware infrastructure because I have no capital at the time. Also, it would be used to pay people who share their knowledge about how to make this project work step by step (e.g. business experts or lawyers). The research that would have to be done would have a good capital too, and the community building process would be accelerated through this as well.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has merits in its idea and the proposer's passion for this project. However, there's no further information to establish an understanding of the project's basic why - what - how. 

For future proposal, I would suggest the proposer to perhaps give an analysis of many old and new solutions are doing the same things, assess their gaps and propose how this solution and Cardano can fill the void. What is the role of blockchain in general and Cardano community in this.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no information or evidence to assess this proposal's feasibility. For future proposals, I would suggest the proposer to consider going to the basics and propose: product vision even in full or in stages, product roadmaps with milestones and KPIs, the proposer's qualifications and evidence specifically for this project, plan for customer development or testing the project, anticipated needs (technical, human resources, timeline, logistics, budget, etc.), and plan to cover these needs for successful delivery of this project, a budget and its breakdown in details.
f6_assessments.q2:
For reasons mentioned above, it's not sufficient to audit the progress and the success of this proposal.

For future proposal, I would suggest the proposal to describe his success (both long-term and short-term within Fund7), and his progress (both in product, and in project delivery) for assessors and voters to trust and fund the project.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you very much for your valuable feedback. I will certainly work on all the points you mentioned and am very grateful for you letting me know about them!

solution: 创建一个超空间，将分散的数据存储与分散的ID管理联系起来：以核实、交叉引用和组织。
experience: 我一生都在上学和上大学，我只是喜欢各种科学。目前，我学习语言/语言学（德语和英语）和数学。
